```{js}
$(function() {
  $(".level2").css('visibility', 'hidden');
  $(".level2").first().css('visibility', 'visible');
  $(".container-fluid").height($(".container-fluid").height() + 300);
  $(window).on('scroll', function() {
    $('h2').each(function() {
      var h2Top = $(this).offset().top - $(window).scrollTop();
      var windowHeight = $(window).height();
      if (h2Top >= 0 && h2Top <= windowHeight / 2) {
        $(this).parent('div').css('visibility', 'visible');
      } else if (h2Top > windowHeight / 2) {
        $(this).parent('div').css('visibility', 'hidden');
      }
    });
  });
})
```

## Comfort under Different Bus Crowding Levels

This plot shows how comfort ratings vary depending on how crowded the bus is.
We can observe that the comfort level tends to decrease as the bus becomes more full.

![Boxplot of comfort by bus occupancy level. Comfort is lowest when the bus is full.](C:/Users/Lenovo/OneDrive - The University of Auckland/Desktop/STATS220/Project 4/plot1.png)

## Headphone Use among Passengers

This bar chart shows how many people were wearing headphones. 
Most passengers were wearing headphones sometimes, with fewer wearing them all the time or not at all.

![Bar chart of headphone usage groups. "Some" is the most common category.](C:/Users/Lenovo/OneDrive - The University of Auckland/Desktop/STATS220/Project 4/plot2.png)
 


## Comfort Ratings by Time of Day

This chart shows the average comfort score at different hours of the day.
It reveals a pattern where comfort may vary depending on time, possibly due to crowding.

![Bar chart of average comfort per hour. Comfort varies across the day.](C:/Users/Lenovo/OneDrive - The University of Auckland/Desktop/STATS220/Project 4/plot3.png)
